title: Why AWS built a no-code tool
author: Frederic Lardinois
content: AWS today launched Amazon Honeycode, a no-code environment built around a spreadsheet-like interface that is a bit of a detour for Amazon’s cloud service.

title: New York City could have an e-scooter pilot program by March
author: Kirsten Korosec
content: New York City is on the verge of approving a shared electric scooter pilot program, opening up a potentially lucrative market and new micromobility battleground in the United States.

title: The Loupedeck CT is a fantastic, flexible editing console for Mac and PC
author: Darrell Etherington
content: For photographers and videographers spending a lot less time on location and a lot more time at the desk right now, one great use of time is going back through archives and backlogs to find hidden gems, and honing those edit skills.

title: Biased AI perpetuates racial injustice
author: Miriam Vogel
content: The murder of George Floyd was shocking, but we know that his death was not unique.

title: IPOs that could happen soon, cannot happen soon enough
author: Alex Wilhelm
content: Earlier today we took a look at two companies that have filed to go public, nCino and GoHealth. The pair join Lemonade in a march toward the public markets.

title: PACT Act takes on internet platform content rules with ‘a scalpel rather than a jackhammer’
author: Devin Coldewey
content: The PACT Act is a new bipartisan effort to reform Section 230, the crucial liability shield that enables internet platforms to exist, approaching the law’s shortcomings “with a scalpel rather than a jackhammer,” as Senator Brian Schatz (D-HI) describes it.

title: AWS launches Amazon Honeycode, a no-code mobile and web app builder
author: Frederic Lardinois
content: AWS  today announced the beta launch of Amazon Honeycode, a new, fully managed low-code/no-code development tool that aims to make it easy for anybody in a company to build their own applications.

title: Sony will now pay researchers $50,000+ for critical PS4 bugs
author: Greg Kumparak
content: Think you’ve found a way to consistently brick someone’s PS4, or make it run code that it shouldn’t? Sony  wants to know — and now they’re willing to pay.

title: Crypto Startup School: How to build companies by building communities
author: Zoran Basich
content: In week four of a16z’s Crypto Startup School, the spotlight shifts to building companies by growing communities of users, developers and employees in a decentralized context.
